trans-unit.source: Using the File connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the File connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the File Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the File Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Get started with the File Connector and add it to your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Get started with the File Connector and add it to your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Connect to a file system to upload, download, and more to your files on a host machine.
trans-unit.target: Connect to a file system to upload, download, and more to your files on a host machine.

trans-unit.source: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data.
trans-unit.target: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data.

trans-unit.source: You can add the File connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the File connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: The File Connector uses the Hybrid Connection Manager for hybrid connectivity to the host file system.
trans-unit.target: The File Connector uses the Hybrid Connection Manager for hybrid connectivity to the host file system.

trans-unit.source: Creating a File connector for your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Creating a File connector for your Logic App

trans-unit.source: To use the File connector, you need to first create an instance of the File connector API app.
trans-unit.target: To use the File connector, you need to first create an instance of the File connector API app.

trans-unit.source: This can be done as follows:
trans-unit.target: This can be done as follows:

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure Marketplace using the + NEW option on the left side of the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure Marketplace using the + NEW option on the left side of the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: Browse to “Marketplace > API Apps” and search for “File Connector”.
trans-unit.target: Browse to “Marketplace > API Apps” and search for “File Connector”.

trans-unit.source: Configure the File connector as follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure the File connector as follows:

trans-unit.source: **Name** - give a name for your File Connector
trans-unit.target: **Name** - give a name for your File Connector

trans-unit.source: Package Settings
trans-unit.target: Package Settings

trans-unit.source: **Root Folder** - Specify the root folder path on your host machine.
trans-unit.target: **Root Folder** - Specify the root folder path on your host machine.

trans-unit.source: Eg.
trans-unit.target: Eg.

trans-unit.source: D:\FileConnectorTest
trans-unit.target: D:\FileConnectorTest

trans-unit.source: **Service Bus Connection String** - Provide a Service Bus Connection String.
trans-unit.target: **Service Bus Connection String** - Provide a Service Bus Connection String.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the service bus namespace is of type Standard and NOT Basic to allow for use of Service Bus Relays.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the service bus namespace is of type Standard and NOT Basic to allow for use of Service Bus Relays.

trans-unit.source: Service Bus Relay is used to connect to the Hybrid Connection Manager.
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Relay is used to connect to the Hybrid Connection Manager.

trans-unit.source: **App Service plan** - select or create a App Service plan
trans-unit.target: **App Service plan** - select or create a App Service plan

trans-unit.source: **Pricing tier** - choose a pricing tier for the connector
trans-unit.target: **Pricing tier** - choose a pricing tier for the connector

trans-unit.source: **Resource group** - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside
trans-unit.target: **Resource group** - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside

trans-unit.source: **Subscription** - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in
trans-unit.target: **Subscription** - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in

trans-unit.source: **Location** - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed
trans-unit.target: **Location** - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed

trans-unit.source: Click on Create.
trans-unit.target: Click on Create.

trans-unit.source: A new File Connector will be created
trans-unit.target: A new File Connector will be created

trans-unit.source: Configure Hybrid Connection Manager
trans-unit.target: Configure Hybrid Connection Manager

trans-unit.source: Once the API App instance is created, browse to its dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Once the API App instance is created, browse to its dashboard.

trans-unit.source: This can be done by clicking on Browse > API Apps > select your File Connector API App.
trans-unit.target: This can be done by clicking on Browse > API Apps > select your File Connector API App.

trans-unit.source: From here the Hybrid Connection Manager needs to be configured.
trans-unit.target: From here the Hybrid Connection Manager needs to be configured.

trans-unit.source: For more information on configuring and trouble shooting the Hybrid Connection Manager see [Using the Hybrid Connection Manager].
trans-unit.target: For more information on configuring and trouble shooting the Hybrid Connection Manager see [Using the Hybrid Connection Manager].

trans-unit.source: Using the File Connector in your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Using the File Connector in your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Once your API app is created, you can now use the File connector as an action for your Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Once your API app is created, you can now use the File connector as an action for your Logic App.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you need to:
trans-unit.target: To do this, you need to:

trans-unit.source: Create a new Logic App and choose the same resource group which has the File connector.
trans-unit.target: Create a new Logic App and choose the same resource group which has the File connector.

trans-unit.source: Follow instructions to [Create a new Logic App].
trans-unit.target: Follow instructions to [Create a new Logic App].

trans-unit.source: Open “Triggers and Actions” within the created Logic App to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow.
trans-unit.target: Open “Triggers and Actions” within the created Logic App to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow.

trans-unit.source: The File connector would appear in the “API Apps in this resource group” section in the gallery on the right hand side.
trans-unit.target: The File connector would appear in the “API Apps in this resource group” section in the gallery on the right hand side.

trans-unit.source: You can drop the File Connector API app into the editor by clicking on the “File Connector”.
trans-unit.target: You can drop the File Connector API app into the editor by clicking on the “File Connector”.

trans-unit.source: File Connector exposes one trigger and 4 Actions:
trans-unit.target: File Connector exposes one trigger and 4 Actions:

trans-unit.source: Each one of these exposes certain properties.
trans-unit.target: Each one of these exposes certain properties.

trans-unit.source: The image below lists the properties for the trigger and Get File Action:
trans-unit.target: The image below lists the properties for the trigger and Get File Action:

trans-unit.source: Once these are configured, the Trigger and Action can be used in your flow.
trans-unit.target: Once these are configured, the Trigger and Action can be used in your flow.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, other actions can be configured as well.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, other actions can be configured as well.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The file trigger will delete the file after it is successfully read from the folder.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The file trigger will delete the file after it is successfully read from the folder.

trans-unit.source: File Connector REST APIs
trans-unit.target: File Connector REST APIs

trans-unit.source: To use the connector outside of a logic App, the REST APIs exposed by the connector can be leveraged.
trans-unit.target: To use the connector outside of a logic App, the REST APIs exposed by the connector can be leveraged.

trans-unit.source: You can view this API Definitions using Browse->Api App->File Connector.
trans-unit.target: You can view this API Definitions using Browse->Api App->File Connector.

trans-unit.source: Now click on the API Definition lens under the Summary Section to view all the APIs exposed by this connector:
trans-unit.target: Now click on the API Definition lens under the Summary Section to view all the APIs exposed by this connector:

trans-unit.source: Details of the APIs can be found at [File Connector API Definition].
trans-unit.target: Details of the APIs can be found at [File Connector API Definition].

trans-unit.source: Do more with your Connector
trans-unit.target: Do more with your Connector

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
